result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa M Jordan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to House of Correction sentence on case 14CF408.

miscConds.notes: A course in anger management.  Parenting classes, ONLY if able to take a class focusing on teenagers.  Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.  Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
No violent contact with victim. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.  No physical discipline of ANY child under the age of 18.

Pay all Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, bail on deposit to apply, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all NON-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.
DOC Agent to contact court to set probation review hearing date for 90 DAYS after release from sentence on 14CF408.

timeConds.notes: STAYED pending review; agent to schedule.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lisa M Jordan in court with attorney Matthew A Lamke.  Cynthia M Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for 6 DAYS time served, straight time. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS, consecutive to House of Correction sentence on case 14CF408.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-A course in anger management.
-Parenting classes, ONLY if able to take a class focusing on teenagers.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No violent contact with victim.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-No physical discipline of ANY child under the age of 18.
-Pay all Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, bail on deposit to apply, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Court WAIVED all NON-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.
-DOC Agent to contact court to set probation review hearing date for 90 DAYS after release from sentence on 14CF408.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief. 
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.

Defendant Lisa M Jordan in court with attorney Matthew A Lamke.  Mike Thurston for Cynthia M Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Final Pretrial. Parties have reacehd a resolution.
AS TO COUNT 1
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 946.49(1)(b), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Lisa M Jordan in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Received & Filed, Copy of Certified Records from case 14CF408. Court joined 14CF588 & 14CF408 for trial. case is set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial with pending case. State's offer is extended to date of final pretrial. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Lisa M Jordan in court with attorney Matthew Lamke.  Kristin M Schrank for Cynthia Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. 23.  State does not have their file today.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for March 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

14RM007009  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
2/12/14 vf

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.   Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MEJ DOB 11/3/98 unless supervised as approved by the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare or Children's Court

Defendant Lisa M Jordan in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Lisa M Jordan in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
